bookingcontactname: KFDC Ecotourism MUNNAR Mattupatty Road, Munnar
activitydescription: Meesapulimala is a travel destination for adventurous tourists. The trekking experience here istruly challenging. Twenty-four kilometres from Munnar to Mattupetty, through the Aruvukaduestate, you will find the basecamp of Meesapulimala. Four kilometres from here is the Rhodovalley which is till where you can travel in a jeep. A night’s stay at the Rhodo Mansion is muchneeded for the next day’s climb to the peak amidst rhododendron trees. The package includes guide service, breakfast, lunch, evening tea & dinner. The cost of thepackage for a two-person stay at Rhodo Mansion in Rs. 6000 and a two-person stay at BaseCamp is Rs. 4000. For a three-person stay at Sky Cottage, the charge is Rs. 9000.

A three-hour trekking through the shola grasslands from the Pampadum Shola National Park toVattavada lets you through the enchanting woodlands and stunted trees of the Shola forests.
Trekking is available here from 8 AM to 2 PM and it costs 250 rupees per person.

bookingcontactname: Wildlife Warden Munnar, Wildlife division, Munnar
activitydescription: The Kurinji Trail is a soft-trekking package available in Eravikulam National Park. Here, you cansee various endangered flora and fauna. The cost of the package is Rs.290 for Indian nationalsand Rs.560 for two foreigners (minimum 2 persons).

bookingcontactname: Wildlife Warden Munnar, Wildlife division, Munnar
activitydescription: The scenic Lakkam waterfalls situated in Lakkam, on the way from Marayoor to Munnar havebeen attracting tourists for a long time, being a favourite destination for those who loveadventure tourism and trekking.The abundant flora and fauna blended with transfixingsurroundings and rocky cliffs of Eravikulam plateau provides a memorable trip for the visitors.

bookingcontactname: Wildlife Warden Munnar, Wildlife division, Munnar
activitydescription: The cascade walk across Lakkam waterfalls, which starts from the Eravikulam streammesmerizes the travellers. The charming giggles of the rushing water and the lush greeneryamidst the woods are an amazing experience while taking a walk. It provides stress-reliefand a peace of mind. This is also a wonderful opportunity to snap the elegance of Munnar.

bookingcontactname: KFDC Ecotourism MUNNAR Mattupatty Road, Munnar
activitydescription: Lauded as the second highest peak in western ghats, Meesappulimala is one of the UNESCOheritage sites. Since the peak resembles that of the face of a tiger, it is renowned so. TheRhodo valley trek trail along with multitudes of biodiversity, Meesapulimala is favoured by allkinds of travellers. Apart from trekking, jungle camp is the most exalting experience this placeoffers. Staying overnight in tents at the base camp, amidst the most delicate part of nature, thisis one of the most exciting programs offered by Kerala Forest development Corporation.

bookingcontactname: KFDC Ecotourism MUNNAR Mattupatty Road, Munnar
activitydescription:
Sky Cottage, the perfect place to grasp the splendour of Meesapulimala, and the
second-highest peak on Western ghats, is under Kerala Forest Development Corporation
(KFDC) at Rhodo Valley. It is located on top of a cliff confronting a glorious waterfall. The
broad glass windows offer an astonishing panoramic view of splendid hills caressed by
blankets of mist. The transparent ceiling gives a sublime visual treat of twinkling stars and
glinting moon. This is an ideal destination for a honeymoon trip as well as an adventurous
trip. Travellers can stay here and enjoy their trekking via Rhodo valley. An experienced
guide accompanies them. The sky cottage also offers delicious food.

bookingcontactname: KFDC Ecotourism MUNNAR Mattupatty Road, Munnar
activitydescription:
Rhodo Mansion is an amazing accommodation facility under Kerala Forest Development
Corporation(KFDC) exclusively for those who want to be a little bit adventurous by having a
trekking trail via Rhodo Valley. Located at a high altitude in the misty hilltop, Rhodo Mansion
is a beautifully designed luxury option for those who love the wilderness and scenic beauty
of Meesapulimala. The views from this mansion are truly amazing and stunning. Night stay
at Rhodo mansion by enjoying a campfire and the delicious local cuisine is one of the
greatest experiences one can have.

activityname: Jungle Camp Pampadum Shola National Park
bookingcontactname: Wildlife Warden Munnar, Wildlife division, Munnar
activitydescription:
Despite being the smallest national park in Kerala, the splendor of the shola forests in
Pampadum Shola National Park will mesmerize everyone’s mind. The Log House provides a
jungle camp package situated in the heart of shola forests. It costs 3000 rupees for 2 people.

bookingcontactname: Wildlife Warden Munnar, Wildlife division, Munnar
activitydescription: Eravikulam National Park, Kerala’s largest national park situated in Munnar, offers jungle campsat Lakkom Log House which is located near the Lakkom Waterfalls. It will be a great opportunityto get acquainted with nature and keep in touch with nature. The cost of the package is Rs.3000for two Indians, Rs.4000 for foreigners, and Rs.1000 for an extra person. The package isavailable for a maximum of four people.

bookingcontactname: Forest Information Centre Wildlife Warden’s Office, Munnar
activitydescription: Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary, the abode of several threatened species and a great destination forall those who love to explore nature, offers the Chinnar Valley Safari Package which is 3 and ahalf hours long. The package is available for a maximum of five people at a rate of 3500 rupeesper person. The check-in centre-Karimutty Interpretation Centre.

The Tea Valley tour, one of the most precious moments in Munnar, takes one through the flowergarden, photo point, Mattupetty Dam, speed boating location, Kundala Dam, and echo point.The tour charge is rs400/- per individual.

The sandal valley tour is a full day trip through Munnar covering unique experiencessuch as Tea garden, Lukkom waterfalls, and Anaimudi peak. The trek also includes avisit to the Orange Plantations, Sandalwood Forest, Muniyara Cave, Thoovanam Falls,and ChinnarWildlife Sanctuary among many others. The trek is an ideal sightseeingexperience to explore the fauna and flora of the place and to relish the beauty andsplendor of the lovely hill station with your loved ones. A standard 4 seater Non A/C caris included in the package for transportation.

The village tour includes a visit to the spectacular Chithirapuram, Karadipara, andKallimaly viewpoints, Kallar and SN Puram waterfalls, and also a look in on Sengulamand Ponmudy dams. Apart from these, the main highlight of the tour is the spice garden visit which mesmerizes the visitors to trail through the spices cultivated and to lingerover the amazing aroma of the place. The suspension bridge is another wonder thatcould be witnessed during the tour. Village tour Munnar is the best way to get awayfrom the hassles of city life and to spend some quality time with nature.

Mankulam is a small village in the Idukki district of Kerala. It is famous worldwide as the
first self-governing institution to produce its electricity. Mankulam is also famous as the
highest peak in south India, the Anaimudi peak is located here. The elephant viewpoint
and the Valara waterfalls are just a few of the many attractions in the place. Anakulam
is known for its elephant abode. In the green ambiance of Anakkulam, local people are
even seen playing football on the riverbank close to the wild elephants. The Mankulam
Anakulam trip is a never to miss tour as it is a one of a kind experience.

One of the breathtaking tours you could take through Munnar would be the
Kolukkumalai Special Trip. Kolukkumalai is the world’s highest elevation tea plantation
which is located at 7900 feet. It is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful and scenic
destinations in the country, known for its spectacular sunrise. An amazing view of the
vistas of Munnar and Kodaikanal hills could be viewed from here on a clear-skied day.
The Kolukkumalai tea estate started in 1920 is another attraction of the trip.

The KSRTC SIGHTSEEING is an affordable package that lets you visit all the important sites 
in Munnar in just one and a half hours. The facility is open from 9 AM to 5 PM, with each bus 
having a 50 seat capacity. The rate per head for an adult is 250 rupees, which perfectly fits the 
bill amount of many travel enthusiasts in our country.
The journey is scheduled to cover Tea Museum, Top Station, Kundala Dam, Echo Point,
 Mattupetty boating location, Mattupetty dam, photo point and flower garden.
